intro: Cynoxylon glabriusculum, commonly known as the smooth-stemmed ironwood, is a small evergreen shrub native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and smooth, dark bark. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by orange-red capsules containing seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas. Due to its hardy nature and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
